channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: PCI RR
item.description: A warm welcome to diamond OA journal Studia Psychologica, the latest & 31st outlet to join our fleet of PCI RR-friendly journals, edited by Vladimira Cavojova and team.Full journal entry: https://rr.peercommunityin.org/about/pci_rr_friendly_journals#h_58361174171692013929778Complete list of PCI RR-friendly journals: https://rr.peercommunityin.org/about/pci_rr_friendly_journals

item.title: Susan L
item.description: We hope to start with neuropixels2.0 soon (multishanks ftw!)So far I've seen this surprisingly low-tech DIY-ish version https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8177890/This one that looks nice, but seems almost a bit delicate for rats (ours are enthusiastically destructive): https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.08.03.551752v1And I believe there are the Atlas Neurotech headstages (but only for neuropixels 1.0?)

item.title: 3Dneuro
item.description: @ChrisWilms23 thanks for the @! @susanleemburg Indeed, we're making the Buskazi lab version for the community (and our own @t1m used it with neuropixels and regular probes) . So far, a bit over 60 labs have received drives from us and the feedback we got was mainly positive.

item.title: Laffy
item.description: Via Acyn..Andrew Weissmann:Bail...It's on the defendant to show he's not at risk of flight...Let me give you the exact words because this is the provision that the court has to find to release someone on bail in Georgia which is that: "the defendant poses *no risk* of intimidating witnesses, or otherwise obstructing the administration of justice"That could be a problem... Just today [Trump attacked on TruthSocial]...

item.title: David Colquhoun
item.description: There have been many 1000s of trials of #acuuncture, a few of them quite good. It has, at most, trivial effects. Yet it's still heavily promoted. It's a classical case where NO MORE research is needed. "After more than 3000 trials, there is no need for yet more. #Acupuncture is dead."http://www.dcscience.net/2013/05/30/acupuncture-is-a-theatrical-placebo-the-end-of-a-myth/

item.title: Electrek.co
item.description: Wide load! Extra thick four-wheeled electric cargo bikes to replace trucks in New York https://electrek.co/2023/08/14/wide-load-extra-thick-four-wheeled-electric-cargo-bikes-to-replace-trucks-in-new-york/?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=mastodon

item.title: Natalie Sedacca
item.description: Open letter by legal academics expressing support for Jacqueline McKenzie and all other lawyers targeted by the media, the Conservative Party and members of the UK government for their immigration legal work https://onedrive.live.com/view.aspx?resid=EE36C0826729A739%2187471&authkey=!AB_AD-y5fuLLFu0#ImmigrationLaw #Lawyers #Rule ofLaw #HumanRights #AsylumSeekers

item.title: ProjectFearlessness
item.description:
"We will shift heaven and earth to help people to get out of Afghanistan. We will do everything we can"Boris Johnson, 2021. ------------------------------------"All 6 men who drowned in the Channel were Afghan. Afghans are running from Afghanistan because of the Taliban
They are on small boats because the U.K. government won’t open safe & legal routes for Afghans like they have for Ukrainians.
Don’t even know what to say anymore"Peymana Assad, 2023.#SafeRoutes

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Accurate profile of Guillaume Cabanac. One of the most innovative, effective, inclusive, (and pleasant!) hunters of low-quality and fake scientific papers.https://www.lemonde.fr/series-d-ete/article/2023/08/15/guillaume-cabanac-le-sisyphe-de-la-depollution-de-la-science_6185437_3451060.html

item.title: Luigi Petrucco
item.description:
Heading direction maps in the larval zebrafish? 😲
With an anatomical organisation? 🤯 Finally time for a paper tooth!
Check out the final version of our work from the Portugues lab with coauthors Hagar Lavian, You Wu, Fabian Svara and @vilim: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41593-023-01308-5
#neuroscienceWhile imaging (restrained) fish larvae, we observed a peculiar bump of activity propagating clockwise and anti-clockwise over a paired hindbrain nucleus. The bump was moving when the fish was turning left or right!

item.description:

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Our next Topic workshop will cover "Getting experiments online with Pavlovia" 🌐 More details on how to join here 👉 https://workshops.psychopy.org/topics/getting-online.html#topicsonline

item.title: Dan Levenstein
item.description: In preparation for our #CCN2023 @CogCompNeuro GAC next week, I’m going to do some polls here this week to take the temperature of the room. 🌡️Very curious to see the range of answers so please pass it on 🔁🙏 and feel free to elaborate - we'll try to take any discussion into account at the workshop📊🧵 #neuroscience #neurobuzz https://gac.ccneuro.org/gacs-by-year/2023-gacs/2023-1

item.description: Little boat on the big lake#Photography #BlackAndWhite #Minnesota #LakeSuperior

item.title: CLaE
item.description:
RT @miriam_ionica
Do you know that astrocytes, like excitatory neurons, are organized into multiple layers across the cortical gray matter? But, astrocytes' laminar organization does not match the classic neuronal layers. Take a look at this nice paperhttps://www.nature.com/articles/s41593-020-0602-1

item.title: D. Elisabeth Glassco
item.description: Until recently, WW 2 Black soldiers’ service, was rarely documented, few interviews with them were conducted, and limited efforts were made to honor Black Americans' crucial contributions to the European victory.This is especially true of black American servicewomen.20/#BlackMastodon #Histodons #History #StillWeRise #BlackHistory #Military #WW2

item.title: Christophe Leterrier 🔬
item.description:
I've not been here much lately, but here's a bit more about our paper just out in the Journal of Cell Biology, “Presynapses contain distinct actin nanostructures” (Twitter trained me to come up with short titles 🤏 and long threads 🧵, which are also doable in Mastodon I hope)
The article is available here: https://rupress.org/jcb/article-abstract/222/10/e202208110/276185/Presynapses-contain-distinct-actin
1/23

item.title: Christophe Leterrier 🔬
item.description: Finally, visualizing these nanostructures in the presynaptic side of a natural synapse was a large project in itself. Simple transfection of actin probes like LifeAct cannot provide good-enough SMLM images, so we developed CRIPSR-based tagging of endogenous actin in neurons 15/23
